children.content: Checking the Difference Between Two Sets
Finding Symmetric Difference Between Two Sets

Set is a collection of items. Let me take you back to your elementary or high school Mathematics lesson. The Mathematics definition of a set can be applied also in Python. Set is a collection of unordered and un-indexed distinct elements. In Python set is used to store unique items, and it is possible to find the
Creating a set with initial items
method to find the length of a set.
We use loops to access items. We will see this in loop section
To check if an item exist in a list we use
Once a set is created we cannot change any items and we can also add additional items.
allows to add multiple items to a set. The
We can remove an item from a set using
method. If the item is not found
method will raise errors, so it is good to check if the item exist in the given set. However,
The pop() methods remove a random item from a list and it returns the removed item.

fruits = {'banana', 'orange', 'mango', 'lemon'}
fruits.pop()  # removes a random item from the set
If we are interested in the removed item.
If we want to clear or empty the set we use
If we want to delete the set itself we use
We can convert list to set and set to list. Converting list to set removes duplicates and only unique items will be reserved.

# syntax
lst = ['item1', 'item2', 'item3', 'item4', 'item1']
st = set(lst)  # {'item2', 'item4', 'item1', 'item3'} - the order is random, because sets in general are unordered
We can join two sets using the

Union
  This method returns a new set

Update
  This method inserts a set into a given set
Intersection returns a set of items which are in both the sets. See the example
A set can be a subset or super set of other sets:
Checking the Difference Between Two Sets
It returns the difference between two sets.
Finding Symmetric Difference Between Two Sets

It returns the symmetric difference between two sets. It means that it returns a set that contains all items from both sets, except items that are present in both sets, mathematically: (A\B) âˆª (B\A)
If two sets do not have a common item or items we call them disjoint sets. We can check if two sets are joint or disjoint using
